response: "I can't keep up with everyone's expectations anymore, it's driving me insane."
"Why do I feel like I have to be perfect all the time? It's exhausting."
"I don't even know who I am anymore, I'm just trying to fit into this perfect image society has created."
"I'm starting to question my own worth and whether I'll ever be good enough."
"Every mistake I make feels like the end of the world, like I've failed everyone around me."
"I can't escape this pressure to be flawless, it's suffocating."
"I'm losing sight of what truly matters because I'm so consumed by this need to be perfect."
"It's like society has set unrealistic standards for me and I'm constantly falling short."
"I'm on the verge of a breakdown, trying to keep up this facade of perfection."
"I wish I could just break free from this endless cycle of comparison and self-doubt."
